subject: Photography
title: Specular vs. Diffuse Reflection
description: A fast breakdown of Specular vs. Diffuse Reflection for builders.

hook.text: A mirror reflects your face perfectly. A white wall reflects light softly everywhere. Same light, different surface.

buildup.text: Specular reflection bounces light at an equal angle, like a mirror. Diffuse reflection scatters it in all directions.

discovery.text: Shiny surfaces create specular highlights â€” bright spots. Matte surfaces spread light evenly and gently.

twist.text: Skin is semi-specular. Oily skin creates bright spots; powdered skin scatters light. Makeup is applied optics.

climax.text: Understanding surface reflection helps predict how any material will look under any light. It's visual literacy.

punchline.text: Light tells you what things are made of.

quiz.question: What is the difference between specular and diffuse reflection?
options: Specular reflects at equal angles; diffuse scatters in all directions
